wikitext.*:
[[File:The Lord of the Rings - The Two Towers - Westemnet Village.jpg|thumb|250px|Westemnet Village - ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers]]'']]
The '''Westemnet''' was the western plains of [[Rohan]]<ref>{{HM|UI}}, entry ''Westemnet'', p. 370</ref> west of the river [[Entwash]].<ref>{{HM|UI}}, entry ''Eastemnet'', p. 365</ref> It probably extended to the river [[Isen]].<ref>{{TT|Riders}}, "There is battle even now upon the Westemnet", p. 437</ref>

The most important of Rohan's settlements and fortifications lay to the south of the Westemnet, where the [[White Mountains]] rose up from the plain. [[Helm's Deep]] was among these, and to the south-east was the seat of the [[Kings of Rohan|Lords of the Mark]], [[Edoras]] itself.

==Etymology==
''Emnet'' means "plain" in [[Rohanese]].<ref name="Nomen">{{HM|N}}, entry '''Westemnet''', p. 778 and entry '''Eastemnet''', p. 769</ref>
